Headline: A tour of Egypt's White Desert
Article_Body: Incredible landscape: The White Desert National Park is one of Egypt's most spectacular landscapes. Amazing location: The White Desert is located in western Egypt, in the Farafa depression. Miles apart: The landscape feels miles away from the bustling streets of Cairo. In fact, it's about a five-hour drive. Popular destination: Trips to this area have become increasingly popular in recent years, both for tourists and locals. Adventure spot: It's also great for outdoor sports and adventuring. Sports paradise: You can enjoy dune bashing, sandboarding, mountain biking and kayaking. Expert perspective: "The White Desert is so different from any place on the planet," Ziad Omran, co-founder of the adventure travel company Destination 31, told CNN Travel earlier this year. Intriguing sights: The desert plays host to some unusual formations. Former life: It's believed this landscape was once a sea or ocean. Photographer's dream: The landscape's makes for an incredible photo subject. English mountain: Nearby the White Desert is the Baharija Oasis, home to the English mountain. Its name comes from the fact there's a ruined British World War I outpost on top of its highest peak. Day end: Sunsets here are as spectacular as you'd expect. The nearby Bahariya Salt Lake is great for kayaking as the evening arrives.
